summary.para: Adds an object to the collection.

param.name: pUnkElement
param.para: Pointer to the object's IUnknown interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: If pUnkElement is NULL, a NULL pointer is added to the collection.

summary.para: Retrieves an object in the collection.

param.name: dwElementIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the object to retrieve. Objects are indexed in the order in which they were added to the collection.

param.name: ppUnkElement
param.para: Receives a pointer to the object's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface. The retrieved pointer value might be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: This method does not remove the object from the collection. To remove an object, call .

summary.para: Retrieves the number of objects in the collection.

param.name: pcElements
param.para: Receives the number of objects in the collection.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Adds an object at the specified index in the collection.

param.name: dwIndex
param.para: The zero-based index where the object will be added to the collection.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Removes all items from the collection.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Removes an object from the collection.

param.name: dwElementIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the object to remove. Objects are indexed in the order in which they were added to the collection.

param.name: ppUnkElement
param.para: Receives a pointer to the IUnknown interface of the object. The caller must release the interface. This parameter cannot be NULL, but the retrieved pointer value might be NULL.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Represents a generic collection of IUnknown pointers.

remarks.para: To create an empty collection object, call .
